text.value: I want image with rounded corners

To add rounded corners to an Image in Jetpack Compose, you can use the clip modifier:
```kt Image( painter = painterResource(id = R.drawable.image), contentDescription = null, modifier = Modifier .clip(RoundedCornerShape(10.dp)) // clip to rounded corners .padding(8.dp) ) ```
The RoundedCornerShape allows you to specify the radius for the rounded corners.
So in your code, you could modify the Image like:
```kt Image( painter = painterResource(id = R.mipmap.extreme_violence), contentDescription = null, modifier = Modifier .padding(8.dp) .clip(RoundedCornerShape(10.dp)) // add rounded corners ) ```
This will clip the Image to have 10dp rounded corners.

Hmm, clipping the Image to rounded corners should work with the code I provided. A few things to check:
- Make sure you are importing `androidx.compose.foundation.shape.RoundedCornerShape`
- Double check that the RoundedCornerShape modifier is applied to the Image, not something else
- Try increasing the corner radius (e.g. 20.dp) to make it more noticeable
- Wrap the Image in a Box or other layout first, in case something else is overriding the rounded corners
For example:
```kt Box {
Image( //... modifier = Modifier.clip(RoundedCornerShape(20.dp)) )
} ```
- Try setting a background color on the Image to see the shape better
- Check preview/runtime - rounded corners sometimes don't show in Preview
Let me know if you are still having issues getting the rounded corner clipping to work on the Image!
